group_works.title: The Use of operational research - Part 1 cutting the queue

results.title: The Human factor
results.creator_credit: Robert McIntosh, Jill Wood and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Basis for Decision”.
Unlike the other films in the series, the Operational Research scientists here look at two studies in which the central problems were human ones. One study was to find how to reduce labour wastage at collieries, the other studied a hospital with high staff turnover and which kept patients longer. Also looks to future potential - in advertising and human relations in industry; in town planning and local government; in transport policy and economic planning in central government.

results.title: Playing it through
results.creator_credit: Julian Cooper, Jill Wood and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Basis for Decision”.
Critical path scheduling is discussed with examples from shipbuilding. Two examples of simulation methods are shown, scheduling production in a steel works and examining military problems.

group_siblings.title: The Use of operational research - Part 1 cutting the queue

results.title: The Use of operational research - Part 1 cutting the queue
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basis for Decision”.
Operational research calculates the probable results of alternate courses of action for planning purposes. Many problems of organisations have similar structures and can be solved by similar methods of analysis and similar mathematical models. One simple structure, the input-service- output situation, is discussed and applied to different queuing problems.

results.title: Basics to Eventing

group_works.title: Horses
group_works.creator_credit: Justin Milne and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Horses
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basics to Eventing”.
Horse riding and good horsemanship in three parts. Pt. 1: “The Ten Commandments” gives an introduction to the basics of good riding. Pt. 2: “Learning to Jump” shows the way in which horses and riders are trained for jumping in the South Australian Police Force Mounted Division. Pt. 3: “The Cross-Country Event” focuses on differing aspects of horsemanship from handling to competition.

results.title: Veneering by the hammer method
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
Introduction to veneers, topside and underside, Keying the ground on a radio cabinet, applying the glue and using the hammer, gouging out the corners and inlaying.
